title: ID please ...
content:
should be pretty straight forward. First thoughts were Clarendon, but the square dot chops that theory off at the legs.

Thanks in advance

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135849im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/CFA_3_4523.png)

 [‹ Toyota Aurion font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135849/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32796 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Parent.com marker like script - Marker Felt Thin {Stephen, Lex, Ken, Brad} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135849/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32758 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ratbaggy

comments.content: Serifa or Glypha — it’s one of the Frutiger slabs.
Egyptienne is a Frutiger slab too, I believe - or at least based on one. Anyway it’s virtually indistinguishable from Serifa. Glypha looks too condensed to me.

thanks pattyfab and marcox

ROCK AND ROLL!! Serifa it is.

Cheers

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design Wellington](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415135849/http:/www.solid-creative.com/design.htm)
